newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.KOREA'S SECURITIES WATCHDOG OPPOSES INTEGRATION.
newsitem.headline: S.KOREA'S SECURITIES WATCHDOG OPPOSES INTEGRATION.

text.p: South Korea's Securities Supervisory Board (SSB) said on Monday it opposed the government's plan to unify the nation's three financial watchdog bodies.

"The integration ignores specialisation of the financial market. In addition, the government's control of the merged body damages the impartiality of the supervisory function," the board said in a statement.

The finance ministry and a presidential panel have promoted financial reforms aimed at mending structural problems of the nation's backward financial industry. The reforms called for establishing a single watchdog body to oversee banks, insurers and securities. The new supervisory board would be under direct control of the prime minister.
The central Bank of Korea has opposed the ministry's plan, saying it should maintain its bank supervisory authority to pursue monetary policy more effectively.
